text: Then she got to wave at a metro operator, ride an escalator tap my phone to pay, and excitedly point at everything out the window. She got to press crosswalk buttons and show a stranger her Kiki’s Delivery Service bag. I got to enjoy a nice spring morning with my happy kid. Thanks, Alexandria!

I just love living here, man. 

My kid absolutely did not consent to her car seat today and I was like, “okay! We’ll take the train,” which led her to squeal with joy. 

(Did that mean I needed to add another stop to errands today? Sure! But I’ll take that over toddler screams.)
(Your department is low-key amazing, though. I’d march into battle behind you.)
I’m thinking about a lot of things after the State of the Union. Surprisingly that includes “how to get my hands on a snickers bar”.

As wonderful as that sounds - I’d love the reading and thinking and the not using gas! - the thing I want is 7.5 feet tall (in addition to four drawers)and I’m six and a half months pregnant which might make that a liiiiittle hard 😂
Oh I completely forgot about this!!
Just Apple Maps - but I’m off work until 3/18 so I can go mid-day this week.
Yeah, they *aggressively* hate free DASH. Between eliminating that and the duke street project they think they can basically balance the budget.

Considering driving up to College Park to get some IKEA stuff that’s inexplicably unavailable in Woodbridge. Can’t get it shipped here either. Am I missing something about how this would be a bad idea or colossal waste of time?

Ooof. 

I’m at an average of six, between espresso shots and cups of drip.
Which….would require enforcement… *headdesk*

Nothing is as wild to me as the people who are mad about parking enforcement on King Street. 

Like, please square your position with -checks notes- every other literal position you hold.

Saw something that was like “procrastination is the worst disease of the 21st century.” 

Did you FORGET what happened in 2020, my LinkedIn friend?

I once asked them if I could get ground espresso to take to my office. They used the same lighter-roast beans they used for their drip coffee and ground it to coffee fine, not espresso fine. I used all the stash they gave me because I’m stingy, but it was like “oh! This is the problem.”

I’ve lost my voice, and I’ve been gargling salt water to try to help. 

Does it work? Or does it just suck so much that it makes you think “maybe I can live with this minor inconvenience after all?”
I’m still sorting through what’s next and I’m nearly there, but in the meantime I’ll be paying attention to ways to make this city more welcoming as a neighbor and not a nonprofit representative!

I know that a lot of you know me as “the one who works in affordable housing” so I just wanted to take a chance to say I’ll be leaving Housing Alexandria next week. 

It’s been a great journey and I love everything I’ve learned, and I’m still going to have big housing opinions about Alexandria.
Did you notice that if you go to the “contact” page it says they’re headquartered in Alexandria, Egypt?

“Sir, Toronto is under attack.”

“My god, what’s happening?” 

“….uh. A giant panda is attacking a boy band.”

My daughter is obsessed with Turning Red, and it’s an incredible movie, but as I watch it for the 50th time I can’t stop thinking about the fact that “giant panda attacks Skydome” would *absolutely* have triggered a phone call to the US president.
We paid $50 for the purifier, and refill filters were 3/$45
We got one when we started traveling with our baby! And I’ll say that every time we did have it, nobody got sick. The time we didn’t, oop, COVID.
Get a wedding outfit that can strap a HEPA filter on the back? Is this fashion?
Oh my gosh he really just said it out loud.

Take it a weird step further. Just some random we pull off the streets of like, Sacramento. Give them 72 hours and see what they say. 

(But yeah, me too.)
Oh gosh congratulations!!
Tattling on the trench coat kids for being cooler than they are.
Yeah, I think if you look up “long-form” in the dictionary there’s a screenshot of his work.
Starting to suspect that “Alexandria” is just a bunch of high-quality newsletters stacked on top of each other in a trenchcoat.
My daughter pointed at my coffee cup today and called it “mama water” and…I mean, I’m proud? Concerned? Feeling exposed?
Make a template document! If you get your doc set just as you like it, save it as a .dotx and you can select that template instead of “new” when you open word every time.
It’s *everywhere* right now, it feels.
That is a nightmare. I’m praying for your loved ones.
Hey, nothing like having an infectious disease to make you think “let’s suffer some more”.
I played a little bit of Overwatch which was nice! But then I got too congested and flipped to Pokémon Snap because I just needed something extremely chill and low stakes.
I was reading it and was just low-key embarrassed for everybody involved.
Yeah, hard same. Started off 2024 with COVID and am on day four of couch-rot.

After 2 years and 9 months, I lost my novid streak on 12/31. Thankfully my husband and kid are both healthy horses. 

Normally I love January and fresh beginnings (like the start of school for adults) but this one has been 🙃 so far. What should I do when I break out of quarantine?
Anyway, Merry Standard Christmas everybody.

There is a Kayla Hornbrook who lives in California whose email is too close to mine. Her family is currently sending around a video called “Teethmas.mov” and all commenting things like “nice to see the teeth all hanging around!” And “I thought I packed it better than that!” 

What is happening.
It was in fact Stracci he was thinking of! We didn’t end up eating there though (needed delivery).
I’m glad I’m not the only one who was deeply confused.
Help me out here Alexandria BlueSky:
You wouldn’t believe it, she walked in and accepted the proof without even suggesting “adding orange cause it’s fun.”

Watching Sesame Street with my daughter, and there’s a whole segment where they play “graphic designers” for a cereal client.

And now I’m gonna have to sit her down and let her know that graphic design involves a lot more pulling your hair out and adding “something oomphy” and a chronic eye twitch.

I did think about that - I didn’t want to directly lift somebody else’s idea. 

(Also cannot emphasize enough, I have only had a piece of banana bread to eat and lunch is an hour away. Creative brain is barely moving.)
Fair!
Proof of concept:
Thank you! This was very helpful
Looking for toys!
Beneficiary!
At some point? This meme ship has sailed.
Trying to help somebody find a toy drive for their family who lives in the “Alexandria section of Fairfax County.” Anybody have a good lead?
Or maybe we could put a lot of people on one really big metal horse and let them even have their own special big metal horse lane and it could run all the way to Maryland and back.

Just saw somebody suggest that traffic was going to get so bad that they’d have to buy a horse to navigate the city. 

Or like…you know. Something like a horse and made of metal but you power it with your feet and you don’t have to feed it?
Waiting patiently.
Impeccable alt text
I, as a fundraising professional working in nonprofit housing, would love to know where people are getting their developer checks today.
She also stuffed a few new years streamers in the bottom row of the tree and, eh. They’re staying.

We used to have such a coordinated, planned Christmas tree, filled with cherished mementos. 

Now we have a toddler so one section of lights are out and the only ornaments are unbreakable Mario Brothers bulbs and a few owls.
This particular line was a 2/10 on your aggro scale and you know it.
I’m very happy most people on here seem to be out running and not watching whatever this corn musical is in the Macy’s parade.
I can work with that!

😂 I like keeping up with the state of conversation more than anything. 

It’s unfortunately why I also keep reading the AlxNow comments against all advice. I’m absolutely certain it’s better than that.

I…think I am? I’ll find out. 

I usually route stuff like this to my work comms box but it’s a little unruly in there right now
Every time I opened BlueSky today I either gasped, laughed, or rolled my eyes right out of my sockets

Parenting experts recommend against spanking, actually. 

(This is a tweet for Alexandria only.)

Really enjoyed reading the ALXtra shout out for our project (thank you for your enthusiasm!) but this image had me cackling - because it’s funny, but also because “somebody interpreted a massing rendering as our actual intended design” actually happened about two years ago.
I feel this in my bones.

I want a pin that says “Hi! I am quick to cry. I tear up at back-to-school collages and stories about dog heroes. I’m pretty sure it’s genetic and I am also 100% fine”, so the next time I am wiping tears at a transit stop nobody needs to feel awkward about it.

Had our second event in three weeks yesterday, which was wonderful and left me very exhausted.

Waltzing into work this morning nearly an hour late holding a coffee is my victory lap.

I’m very very glad our heater is being replaced in October and not December.

But. 

I’m not looking forward to not having heat in my house again until tomorrow.

I’m informed that local, uh, “preservationists”, are lamenting that an abandoned grocery store and parking lot we’re going to replace with affordable housing was in a 1970s spy thriller. 

Somebody, quick, call the Office of Historic Alexandria. Burt Lancaster was here!
She’s a better person than me (who will only read hot takes about it until I can get a recording I can maybe watch at 1.5 speed instead.)
We know how to have a good time on a Thursday night around here
I had a million warnings and I still jumped clean out of my skin.
Desperate to know your results here.
It being October already is - frankly? Rude.
Still on a high from last night. I love the passionate, nerdy, caring, invested people in this city and who believe in our housing mission.
In most circumstances that’s a plus, but I don’t think the terms of the ABC license allow for that this time.
Ah, gotcha. Looking forward to it!

Hey, if you can make it at all we’re very happy to see housing supporters! 

Also, hello neighbor! We’re actually moving in November a few blocks out, as right now we already have one person temporarily occupying the kitchen table.
The Garden, in the West End (*not* the Del Ray Garden). 5380 Eisenhower Ave Suite C, just off of Van Dorn metro station.
It’s my event, actually! I’m happy to answer any questions if you have them?
Thank you for looking out ❤️❤️

My iron levels are frequently low. Falafel has iron. My workplace cares about health and well-being. 

In this essay, I will explain why I need a Perfect Pita stipen-
But since the 5th?

Okay am I losing it or has our local print paper just not bothered to write a story about the zoning code proposal since it’s release? Usually by this point I get a google alert letting me know they’ve randomly used one of my images on an unrelated housing story again by now.
I never feel more like my dad than when I see “30% chance of rain” and go and stand on the patio with my hands on my hips to check the meteorologist’s work.
Maturing is owning the fact that you have “a favorite Chipotle” for some reason.
I know it’s complex, but Van Dorn metro is just asking for intervention.
The AlxNow comment section on the zoning updates is not providing the 3 PM coffee break material I was hoping for.
Yeah I’d love to hang! I missed being able to keep up with this all on the other site.
Anyway “needing a place to deal in local snark again” is the complete reason I finally booted up BlueSky.

Local media called a colleague’s number who hasn’t been with the organization for a full quarter (when they have my personal phone number?) asked for something above that person’s former pay grade, and then never followed up. 

And nobody wanted to hear about this at my dinner table?
